name: Fairfield Inn Lumberton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only spent 1 night in this hotel on our way to Virginia from Florida. The room was small for Marriott Fairfield Inns and did not have a fridge or microwave. However, the beds were very comfortable and the pillows were terrific. Often, even at better hotels, the pillows are awful. Although we could hear the highway traffic noise, it was not too bad. We found the breakfast disappointing. There was a selection of cereals, bagels and waffles. However, there is a Dennys down the road at the Holiday Inn where you can purchase breakfast and so we went there. The front desk staff was very pleasant and for the price, I would recommend this hotel as a stop over.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds and great pillows

reviews.text: We stayed 1 night on way down to Disney from PA. We didn't arrive til 11pm, but the clerk was very friendly. I asked if parking lot was safe for car break-ins and there was a man there that told me he walks the lot during the night and keeps an eye on things. The room was nice but did not have a refrigerator. 2 queen beds were comfortable and clean. Bathroom seemed in good working order, but lacked an exhaust fan. There was only 1 ice machine and it was on 1st floor.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: The breakfast was excellent. There was a huge selection of cereals, pastry, microwave sandwiches, waffles, and drinks. There was also yogurt and other kid friendly things.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff and clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was recommended to me by my neighbor, whose company uses it for their bus drivers to stay on their trips. She highly recommended it and I do too. Enjoy!!
reviews.title: Very convenient and well kept, returning guests

reviews.text: After reading reviews and searching different hotels in the Lumberton area I decided to stay at this hotel. Upon check in the two young ladies at the desk were very friendly and helpful. (Mary & Antwanette were there names I believe) I asked about how long it would take to get to Elizabethtown, they took the time to print directions out for me. Once I got to my room, it was very clean & alot of space. They beds were comfortable, did not here any noise from the traffic on I-95. Very well pleased and will definately stay here again when in the area.
reviews.title: A lovely night

reviews.text: We decided to stay in Lumberton on our way to Florida. The hotel was at a great half way point located right off of I95. I thought the staff was a little rude during my check-in. A gentlemen was checking in a customer and a lady was staying beside him stuffing envelopes. After about 5 minutes or so, she looked up and said she would be with me in a few minutes. The phone rang and she answered the phone and placed the person on hold then she checked me in. After the gentleman was done with his customer, he helped the person placed on hold. I did not understand this customer service.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for half-way point to Florida

reviews.text: Room was clean and breakfast was good. Beds seemed a bit worn. Great location off of I-95. There is a Cracker Barrel located right next door. No indoor pool at this Fairfield Inn. Did not see the outdoor pool which was not open.
reviews.title: Great hotel.

reviews.text: Stayed just one night. Staff very friendly and efficient. The was clean, quiet and comfortable. Good cookies in the lobby. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Very pleasant experience

reviews.text: We decided to try Fairfield Inn Lumberton instead of a more expensive Marriott hotel in Fayettesville. Our family of 4 paid $94 for a one night stay. Our room was great. It was very clean, very quiet and right next door to a Cracker Barrel Restaurant, which we walked to for dinner. A free breakfast was included with our stay and was great!! A value for a family with two children. A great stay, will definitely go back again. One little note...we parked near the lobby under one of the bordering trees (not sure what it was)....in the morning when we left, our van had tiny little droplets of sap all over the front and windows. Coming from Florida, our van needed a wash anyway, so we didn't make an issue of it. One quick run through a carwash and it was fine. Ending on a positive note, GREAT place to stay!!
reviews.title: Very nice for the price

reviews.text: Modern, up to date, newly furnished rooms,with a good sized flat screen, nice public space to eat with a good selection of FREE breakfast foods
reviews.title: I suspect the high ratings are due to the lack of accomodations in Lumberton...
Great Place. Loved it!
reviews.text: Stopped on my way home from Florida. Found the staff to be very courteous and helpful. Room was very clean and nicely furnished with updated furniture. The entire hotel had an updated look and feel. The free continental breakfast had just about any thing you could want. Used my AAA card to get a room discount. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Spent one night while traveling north. Large, clean room. Did not have a fridge. Free continental breakfast included. Not great for a long stay as it is located next to Route 95 and. Could be noisy. Not sure if there was a pool, but there were nice lobby areas.
reviews.title: Convenient stop along Route 95

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with wife on trip to Virginia. Everything was very clean and the room was perfect. The king bed was a perfect place for a great nights sleep. The continental breakfst was very nice with waffles, Jimmy Dean biscuits, cereal, etc. Plenty of variety for most taste. Coffee was excellent. The staff were friendly, attentive, and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. After we checked in fresh cookies were made available to the guest and they were delicious. There is a Cracker Barrel next door for dinner, just a short walk from the Fairfield. Will definitel stay here again in the future.
reviews.title: A nice place to spend the night.

reviews.text: What can I say more? I have stayed in this hotel twice within four months. Each time I have stayed more than a week. From the front desk, to housekeeping, from the courteousness of the host for breakfast etc. They really aim to please. They have been accommodating, welcoming and friendly EACH TIME. Housekeeping ALWAYS on point. Each day they are knocking on my door consistently cleaning. To me that's a plus. I have been in hotels (large and small) that I'm waiting all day for towels, trash to be thrown out, and/or they halfway clean my bathroom. Front desk employees have been a jewel. The consistency of the up keep of the hotel: from the cleaning the lobby, cleaning and minor fixes in my room, vacuuming each stories of the building. The building is in great condition. Very well decorated. The breakfast is very decent for it to be a "continental breakfast" It is always consistently stocked since I've been here for a week at a time. Thank you to Fairfield Inn! For making my travels for my family and I a success! THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!!!
reviews.title: DIAMOND IN THE RUFF!!!

reviews.text: We received a special deal from the NC welcome center. You couldn't get a better deal anywhere. This was worth the extra half hour drive past Fayetteville.
reviews.title: Great stop along I-95

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to be in Lumberton unexpectedly and the locals recommended we stay at the Fairfield Inn. It was a good choice. We checked in late on a Friday night and Troy, the young man at the desk, was very helpful and kind. We requested a quiet room and he gave us just that - a room on the second floor - where our sleep was undisturbed and restful. The room was spotless and the queen beds were very comfortable, with lots of pillows and crisp sheets. The bathroom amenities were just what we needed, shower pressure was great and hot water remained plentiful for all 3 of us. The Continental breakfast provided what we needed to start the day and allowed us to avoid a hunt for something to eat in the area as we were tight on time. The Inn is a good place to stay and very convenient to I-95 for those passing through North Carolina. We would stay there again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable, Convenient and Kind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just like everyone else, we stopped here for one night while traveling on I-95. There's a cracker barrel next door w/a sidewalk attachment. Breakfast had many options, including single serve grapefruit containers. They did accept a coupon we had picked up earlier at a McDonalds that was available only to walkins. Hot water and good pressure in the shower. There were five, count 'em five pillows on each bed. Love the cookies down in the lobby in the evening.
reviews.title: clean and comfortable

reviews.text: After traveling all day, this hotel did not disappoint. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Breakfast was well-maintained and satisfying. My only criticism: television remote didn't work.
reviews.title: Will keep me loyal to Marriott

reviews.text: Enjoy this hotel with confidence!
reviews.title: Lovely stay at Fairfield

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed a good place to sleep for just a night, one that wasn't very expensive and one that was conveniently located to i-95. It had to be approximately 8 to 9 hours away from Florida, because after that lengthy drive, we would be exhausted to continue.
reviews.title: Just what we needed.

description: The Fairfield Inn Lumberton has been recently remodeled to make us an even more attractive property. With the addition of a hot breakfast and our manager's reception twice weekly, you can have all the amenities of home while you are away from home.
